metadata.feature_description: Analytics dashboard specifically for the Answers module showing Q&A metrics

steps.action: Navigate to PersonaBar > Dashboard > Community Analytics
steps.expected: Community Analytics dashboard should load with module tabs
steps.actual: Community Analytics dashboard loaded successfully with Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, and Wiki tabs visible

steps.action: Click on Answers tab to view answer-specific metrics
steps.expected: Answers tab should be selected and display Q&A-specific metrics
steps.actual: Answers tab selected successfully, displaying Community Health metrics including: Questions older than 24 hours without Answers, Questions older than 6 hours with no Views, Question older than 12 hours with views but no interaction, Questions with lots of comments, Questions older than 24 hours with no votes, Questions older than 24 hours with unaccepted answers, Questions and answers with down-votes

steps.action: Click on the date range picker in the Answers analytics panel
steps.expected: Time period options should be displayed (Day, Week, Month, Year, Custom)
steps.actual: Time period dropdown opened showing Day, Week (selected), Month, Year, and Custom options

steps.action: Select Month from the time period options
steps.expected: Date range should update to show a full month of data
steps.actual: Date range updated from '21 Feb 2026 - 27 Feb 2026' (week) to '28 Jan 2026 - 27 Feb 2026' (month). Comparative Term dropdown also updated to '1 m'. Charts now show monthly data points from JAN 28 to FEB 27

steps.action: View the Community Health metrics for question resolution tracking
steps.expected: Metrics should display question resolution rates and unanswered questions percentage
steps.actual: Community Health section displays 'Questions older than 24 hours without Answers: 0%' and 'Questions older than 24 hours with unaccepted answers: 0%' - these metrics track question resolution rates effectively

steps.action: Review all Q&A quality metrics in the Community Health section
steps.expected: Answer quality metrics should be visible showing votes, interactions, and engagement
steps.actual: Answer quality metrics displayed: 'Questions with lots of comments: 0%', 'Questions older than 24 hours with no votes: 0%', 'Questions and answers with down-votes: 0%', 'Question older than 12 hours with views but no interaction: 0%'. Engagement section shows Interacted: 0, Formed Relationship: 0, Shared: 0

steps.action: Switch from Answers tab to Blogs tab to verify data isolation
steps.expected: Blogs tab should show different, Blog-specific metrics (not Q&A metrics)
steps.actual: Blogs tab displays Blog-specific metrics: 'Blogs older than 6 hours with no Views: 0%', 'Blogs older than 24 hours without Comments: 0%', 'Blogs with more than 2 deleted comments: 0%'. This confirms module-specific data isolation - Answers shows Q&A metrics while Blogs shows blog-specific metrics

steps.action: View the Comparative Term feature for each metric
steps.expected: Each metric card should display both current value and comparative term value for time-based comparison
steps.actual: Each Community Health metric card displays two values: the current period value (e.g., 0%) and a 'Comparative Term' value (e.g., 0%) below it. The Comparative Term dropdown in the header allows selecting comparison periods (1y, 1m, 1w). This enables comparing metrics across different time periods

observations: The Answers Module Analytics dashboard displays seven Q&A-specific Community Health metrics that track question resolution and answer quality
Time period filtering works correctly with Day, Week, Month, Year, and Custom options, automatically adjusting the Comparative Term dropdown to match
Module-specific data isolation is confirmed - each module tab (Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Wiki) shows metrics specific to that content type
The Comparative Term feature allows comparing current metrics against historical periods (1 year, 1 month, 1 week)
All metrics currently show 0% as there is no Q&A data in the test environment - this is expected behavior for an empty dataset
The dashboard also includes Engagement charts (showing daily engagement over time), Creates & Views metrics, Trending Tags section, and Popular Content section
Export functionality is available via the Export button in the header
